H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5064.def: = process by which liquids flow down

H6313.def: = state in which humans lack physical strength

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3985.def: = state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H7878.def: = action by which humans produce inarticulate sounds expressing distress

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H8109.def: = folds of skin which cover the eye when it is closed

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H5058.def: = musical instrument with strings, such as a {L:lute<SDBH:כִּנֹּור>} or {L:lyre<SDBH:נֵבֶל>}

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7878.def: = action by which humans produce inarticulate sounds expressing distress

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H2664.def: = action by which humans carefully examine a place in order to find people or objects located in it or in order to gain information about it

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H2186.def: = process by which an object acquires characteristics that are considered unacceptable

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H7521.def: = state in which an animal or its meat is acceptable to God as sacrifice

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H656.def: = to be no longer present in a certain location

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H562.def: = words spoken by humans and deities

H1584.def: = process by which an object ceases to exist

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H7092.def: literally: to close part of one's body; hence: = to stop engaging part of one's body ► in order to stop performing a certain action

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H5945.def: = state of being in an elevated position

H4611.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3050.def: = short form of {L:יהוה<SDBH:יהוה>}, only found in poetic texts

H6382.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H1897.def: = causative action by which humans causes other humans or objects to be removed from their place,◄ as if by blowing them away

H6467.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H7878.def: = action by which humans produce inarticulate sounds expressing distress

H5949.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H6382.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H3130.def: = man; ◄ eleventh son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and first son of {L:Rachel<SDBH:רָחֵל>}; ► father of {L:Ephraim<SDBH:אֶפְרַיִם>} and {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}, each founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2342.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H7264.def: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

H5645.def: = mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds

H2229.def: = process by which water is released in copious quantities

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H2671.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1534.def: = ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made of a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outer rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground

H1300.def: = process by which bright flashes of light are seen between clouds and the ground or within clouds, often accompanied by thunder; ≈ regarded as fire from heaven and arrows or spears from God

H215.def: = process by which something reflects light; ≈ associated with well-being

H8398.def: primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7264.def: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H7635.def: literally: path; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H6119.def: = the back part of the foot of humans and animals below the ankle

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H175.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}; brother of {L:Moses<SDBH:מֹשֶׁה>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► first high {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}
